content: Is there an easy way to state that a string (value on Identifier) should be treated as a uuid type - or should I just write an invariant that does the datatype check?
Its the same as the invariant here: http://build.fhir.org/datatypes.html#uuid

I think you need to apply the invariant. Luckily, in FSH, you can define an invariant like this once and then apply it in multiple places. I suppose you also might be able to profile string and put the invariant on its root element, but I don't know if other tools would expect a profile on a primitive type -- so that could be risky.
